prompt: <description>Part 1: Construction of a Three-Dimensional Rectangular Prism Step 1: Creating the Coordinate System Begin by creating a new coordinate system. Set the Euler angles to 0.0, 0.0, -90.0 degrees and the translation vector to 0.0, 0.25, 0.0. Step 2: Drawing the 2D Sketch Next, proceed to draw a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the new coordinate system. Step 3: Creating Faces and Loops 1. Create a new face (face\\_1) and within it, a loop (loop\\_1). 2. Add four line objects inside loop\\_1: a. line\\_1 with start point as (0.0, 0.0) and end point as (0.75, 0.0) b. line\\_2 with start point as (0.75, 0.0) and end point as (0.75, 0.125) c. line\\_3 with start point as (0.75, 0.125) and end point as (0.0, 0.5) d. line\\_4 with start point as (0.0, 0.5) and end point as (0.0, 0.0) Step 4: 3D Transformation and Extrusion With the 2D sketch completed, scale it by 0.75 along all axes and then transform the 2D sketch into 3D using a combination of rotation and translation defined by the coordinate system above. Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model with a depth of 0.125 toward the positive normal direction and another 0.125 in the opposite direction. Part 2: Formation of a Rectangular Prism with a Triangular Cutout Identical to Part 1, create a new coordinate system using the specified Euler angles and translation vector. Step 1: Drawing the 2D Sketch Draw two separate 2D sketches on the X-Y and X-Z planes, for two separate faces. Step 2: Creating Faces, Loops, and Lines (Face 1) 1. Create a new face (face\\_1) and within it, a loop (loop\\_1). 2. Add three line objects inside loop\\_1: a. line\\_1 with start point as (0.0, 0.25) and end point as (0.5, 0.25) b. line\\_2 with start point as (0.5, 0.25) and end point as (0.0, 0.5) c. line\\_3 with start point as (0.0, 0.5) and end point as (0.0, 0.25) Step 3: Creating Faces, Loops, and Lines (Face 2) 1. Create a new face (face\\_2) and within it, a loop (loop\\_1). 2. Add four line objects inside loop\\_1: a. line\\_1 with start point as (0.625, 0.0) and end point as (0.75, 0.0) b. line\\_2 with start point as (0.75, 0.0) and end point as (0.75, 0.125) c. line\\_3 with start point as (0.75, 0.125) and end point as (0.625, 0.1875) d. line\\_4 with start point as (0.625, 0.1875) and end point as (0.625, 0.0) Step 4: 3D Transformation and Extrusion With the 2D sketches completed, scale them by 0.75 along all axes, transform each of them into 3D using a combination of rotation and translation defined by the coordinate system above. Extrude both shapes to generate 3D models with a depth of 0.0625 toward the positive normal direction and another 0.0625 in the opposite direction. Perform the "CutFeatureOperation" on the first part using the second part to achieve the desired triangular cutout.</description>
